Paul Merson criticised Andros Townsend's England team selection in a Sky Sports column. Townsend responded by scoring for England against Italy and tweeting back at Merson. Merson admitted he was wrong about Townsend. Despite this, Merson has criticised Townsend again after Townsend played for seven minutes in Tottenham's draw with Burnley.

Chelsea has made a formal offer to FC Tokyo for their 22-year-old forward, Yoshinori Muto, as confirmed by FC Tokyo president Naoki Ogane. Muto, a Japan international, would be loaned to Vitesse Arnhem if he joins Chelsea. Ogane stated that Chelsea's interest is not related to the Yokohama Rubber sponsorship deal. Muto has 11 international caps for Japan and recently graduated with an economics degree.  A Â£4 million deal has been suggested, but Muto has not yet decided if he will join Chelsea, although he is honoured by the offer.

A study has found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers. This research compared the weight and height of over 12,000 two-year-olds with their antibiotic prescription records and found that children who had taken antibiotics as young babies were more likely to be overweight.  Boys seemed particularly prone to weight gain after antibiotics. Researchers suggest antibiotics may cause weight gain by killing gut bacteria that would normally consume some food, freeing up more food for the body, or by increasing appetite.  The lead researcher warned that antibiotic exposure before six months of age or repeatedly during infancy is linked to increased body mass in healthy children and may contribute to the childhood obesity epidemic.  They highlight the importance of careful antibiotic use in infancy, noting that while antibiotics are crucial for health, their extended use has unexpected consequences.

A Queen's Guard slipped and fell on a manhole cover at Buckingham Palace during the Changing of the Guard. This incident occurred in front of hundreds of tourists and was recorded by a holidaymaker named David Meadwell. The guard lost his footing, dropped his rifle, and knocked his bearskin. The guard was embarrassed by the event, but quickly got back to his feet as his colleagues continued marching. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident.

A remake of the 1977 miniseries "Roots", which had over 100 million viewers, will air in 2016.  A&E, Lifetime, and History will simulcast the story of Kunta Kinte, an African slave. LeVar Burton, who played Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new version, which is described as "original" and "contemporary" and will draw more from Alex Haley's novel.  Producers will consult scholars for authenticity and aim to reach both original fans and a new generation, highlighting the story's continued relevance.

A former royal footman, Christopher Lawler, claims that palace aides at Clarence House attempted to force him into an orgy in January 1978 on his first day of work. He states he was pinned to a chair and groped by a male staff member, leading him to leave his job immediately.  He claims his initial complaint was ignored, and after further delays, his later report to palace officials last year was eventually passed to the police. Police are currently investigating these claims, and a retired royal aide has been interviewed but denied involvement. The Palace has stated they will cooperate with the police probe.

Jesse and Melissa Meek, an Oregon couple, announced they are expecting a child through a rap video set to the theme song of the '90s sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air'.  This video, featuring the couple rapping in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. In the video, Melissa mentions living in Happy Valley, Oregon and their journey to becoming pregnant.  At the end of the video, the couple share a sonogram of their unborn child. The video was created so loved ones living far away could learn about the pregnancy and the couple were surprised by the video's popularity.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh in the 1939 film 'Gone With the Wind' sold for $137,000 at a Heritage Auction in Beverly Hills, California on Saturday. The gray jacket and skirt ensemble, originally slate blue-gray, was worn by Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in several scenes, including scenes with Rhett Butler and in the shanty town. The dress was one of over 150 items from the film auctioned from the collection of James Tumblin, who acquired the dress for $20 after it was going to be thrown away. Other items auctioned included a straw hat worn by Leigh, trousers and jacket worn by Clark Gable, and a bonnet worn by Leigh and Olivia De Havilland.

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The incident occurred on Saturday around 3pm when the boy slipped from his mother's hold and fell 10 to 12ft into the pit. His parents rescued him before emergency services arrived. He sustained minor bumps and bruises and a leg injury, and is in stable condition at MetroHealth Medical Center. Zoo officials believe the cheetahs did not approach the boy because they were scared. The zoo is planning to press child endangerment charges against the family and closed the cheetah exhibit. Eyewitness accounts suggest the child was dangled over the railing.

A speed camera, previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit, is now angled directly at a house in Birmingham, West Midlands. This camera has not been operational for over two years, as all fixed speed cameras in the West Midlands were switched off in March 2013 due to outdated technology.  It is unknown who re-positioned the camera, but Birmingham City Council is aware of the situation and will investigate, with potential removal of the camera.  Fixed cameras in the region have been decommissioned since 2013 and while a pilot program for new digital cameras is in development, this specific camera is not included in those plans.

Usain Bolt will compete for Jamaica at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas next month on May 2nd and 3rd.  He is fit and ready to run and is happy to be part of the Jamaican team.  The Jamaica Athletics Administrative Association is pleased Bolt will be running and expects 'sprint magic'. The full Jamaican team list will be announced shortly.

Neymar and Dani Alves from the Barcelona football team watched the Barcelona basketball team defeat Real Madrid in their Euro League El Clasico match. Despite this loss, Real Madrid remains at the top of their Euro League division. Prior to this, Neymar played for Brazil in a match against Chile which Brazil won 1-0. In La Liga, the Barcelona football team, for which Neymar and Alves play, will compete against Celta Vigo on Sunday as they aim for a treble of trophies. Before the international break, Barcelona's football team had won their own El Clasico and were leading La Liga by four points.

Italy is facing a rising wave of migrants from Africa and the Middle East attempting to reach Europe.  Over a recent period from Friday to Monday, 8,480 migrants were rescued.  There are fears that 400 migrants may be missing from a potentially capsized boat, but this remains unconfirmed by the Italian Coast Guard.  In the first three months of 2015, Italy registered over 10,000 migrant arrivals, with many coming from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria.  Sadly, at least 480 migrants have died in the Mediterranean Sea since the start of the year due to dangerous conditions.

Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is happy that Alexis Sanchez chose to join Arsenal over Liverpool. Wenger is unsure of the exact reason Sanchez chose Arsenal, but acknowledges Liverpool's interest in Sanchez may have been used as leverage in negotiations regarding Luis Suarez's move to Barcelona. Sanchez has made an immediate positive impact at Arsenal, scoring 19 goals this season and Wenger praises Sanchez's qualities and impact on the team. Wenger also downplayed speculation linking him to Liverpool's Raheem Sterling and is impressed with how Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has developed his team.

Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner, will attempt to break cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. He aims to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes, hoping to beat the current record of 52.491km set by Rohan Dennis. Wiggins views the hour record as a 'holy grail' and wants to challenge himself and motivate others. Tickets for the event at the Lee Valley VeloPark will be available from April 19, and it will be broadcast live on Sky Sports.

Serena Williams, a French Open champion, played against Sara Errani in the Fed Cup and won in three sets.  Williams described this match as an 'eye-opener' regarding her readiness for the claycourt season.  Despite Williams' singles win, the US team lost to Italy 3-2, with Williams and Alison Riske losing their doubles match, resulting in the US team being relegated to World Group II.  Tough weather conditions were present during the match. The US team captain stated they need to work harder to return to the World Group next year.

River Plate are interested in signing Radamel Falcao, a Manchester United striker, although they acknowledge a deal is complicated. River Plate's vice president stated they 'dream of Falcao Garcia' and that 'the doors are open' for his return. Falcao previously played for River Plate for eight years before moving to Porto in 2009.  Falcao is currently on loan at Manchester United where he has struggled, scoring four Premier League goals. It is uncertain if Manchester United will keep him. Falcao has recently equalled Colombiaâs all-time goalscoring record with 24 goals. He previously scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for River Plate.

Ella Henderson, who gained fame on The X Factor in 2012, has become the face of Batiste dry shampoo for their 2015 'Ready For It' campaign. This is her first brand collaboration. The campaign images feature Henderson with various hairstyles against a blurred city background. The partnership between Henderson and Batiste was arranged by the MILES agency and includes a TV advertisement featuring her song 'Mirror Man'. Henderson has expressed excitement about working with Batiste, a product she uses. Mark Hargreaves from Crown Talent & Media Group highlights this campaign as Henderson's first endorsement and notes the natural fit between her and the Batiste brand.

A billboard featuring officer Pablo Torres has been erected in Kenosha, Wisconsin. This is after officer Torres shot and killed Aaron Siler on March 14, who was armed with a weapon. The Kenosha Professional Police Association paid for the billboard to thank the community for their support.  Siler's family and friends are shocked by the billboard, calling it disrespectful, with family friend Kathy Willie stating it felt like 'thank you for killing Aaron'.  Officer Torres is currently on leave while the shooting of Siler is investigated.  Prior to this shooting, Torres also shot and wounded Terry Knight, who was armed with knives, which was deemed justified. Aaron Siler was wanted on a felony probation and parole warrant and was shot after a vehicle and foot pursuit.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the Pakistan border in Negur, Iran. Three militants were also killed by Iranian forces. Iranian officials stated the militants crossed from Pakistan and requested Pakistani authorities apprehend the surviving militants.  Jaish al Adal, an anti-Iranian group based in Pakistan, claimed responsibility for the attack. Pakistan condemned the attack and stated they are investigating the incident.

In Japan, a political discussion about UFOs occurred, prompted by lawmaker Antonio Inoki.  Defense Minister Gen Nakatani stated that the Air Self Defense Force has never encountered extraterrestrial unidentified flying objects, clarifying that while jets are scrambled to investigate unidentified flying objects, these have been identified as birds or objects other than aircraft from Earth.  Inoki asked about protocols for extraterrestrial threats and research into alien visitors, despite admitting uncertainty about the existence of aliens.  This is not the first time Japanese politicians have discussed potential alien encounters, as a previous discussion occurred in 2007 regarding the legal ramifications of defending against an outer space invasion.

A 35-year-old passenger named Jin Pai was hospitalised with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks after breaking a toilet at Hefei Xinqiao International Airport in Hefei. He was squatting on the toilet rim because he did not want to touch the seat due to cleanliness concerns, when the porcelain toilet tipped over and shattered. He was found bleeding and received dozens of stitches in hospital.  He initially confessed to squatting but later told police he was sitting, possibly to avoid compensation. Authorities believe it was an accident and reminded people to sit on toilets.

Photographer YÃ»ki Aoyama has created a series of images for his book 'Daughter and Salary Man' featuring teenagers and their fathers. In each image, daughters smile at the camera while their fathers leap in the air, often in suits.  The photos aim to show the fathers' fun side and are taken in front of Japanese landmarks.  The images have gained online interest, though little else is known about them.

Paul Downton's dismissal as England's managing director is a talking point, but focus has shifted to the county championship season. Kevin Pietersen attended a Surrey team photo event at the KIA Oval before the county season, appearing thoughtful yet jovial. Downton's sacking has increased the possibility of Pietersen's return to the England team, after being axed by Downton in 2014 following a disastrous Ashes tour. Pietersen has rejoined Surrey to try and get back into the England Test team for the Ashes this summer. Surrey will begin their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19 and play Oxford MCCU on Sunday. Pietersen joked with photographers and team-mates at the photo event.

Romanian club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. He was initially fired on Wednesday but reinstated the next day by the owner, Angelo Massone.  After Ceahlaul were beaten 2-0 by FC Botosani on Saturday, Ze Maria was sacked again. Ze Maria, a former Brazil defender with 25 caps, was Ceahlaul's third coach this season, having replaced Florin Marin in January. He will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Radamel Falcao's former teammate thinks Falcao is regretting his loan move to Manchester United. Falcao has struggled at Manchester United, scoring only four goals this season during his season-long loan. Manchester United are unlikely to make his transfer permanent for Â£46 million. Falcao was not happy in France at Monaco, but his former teammate believes he would have been better off staying at Monaco as he would have played and participated in the Champions League.

A tall man wearing a 'distinctive' cartoon mask robbed a dairy in Christchurch on Saturday around 12.30pm.  He was wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt and is described as 'very tall'. He demanded cash from the owner's daughter, threw the cash register, and stole the till and about $1500 in cash from the Union St dairy.  Police are asking for public assistance to identify the robber, who is still at large, and have stated no weapons were seen.

A video showing a crocodile swimming through a marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its jaws has been viewed over half a million times. Tourist Tim Weston from New Zealand witnessed the event and stated the dog belonged to a local bike shop owner. The crocodile held the dog for hours in the marina, which is near a crocodile sanctuary. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta and are known to live in the mangroves and nearby sanctuary. Social media users reacted with horror to the video.

Hull City, managed by Steve Bruce, are struggling to stay in the Barclays Premier League after a 2-0 defeat by Southampton.  Bruce remains confident they can avoid relegation, despite only achieving six wins this season when he initially targeted ten, now hoping eight or nine wins will be enough.  Hull lost to Southampton due to a penalty and a late goal, and are now close to the drop zone with difficult upcoming games. Bruce attributes their struggles to injuries of key players, but believes his team can overcome this and remain in the Premier League. Southampton's win moved them up to fifth in the league.  Separately, Southampton manager Ronald Koeman will address team rules after a disagreement over who should take a penalty during the game.

A teacher, Ian Guffick from Mitton Manor Primary School, was banned from teaching after he allowed pupils to change their SATs exam answers after the exam session had finished.  He also changed some answers himself, leading to an investigation and the Department for Education annulling the school's SATs results for last year.  Although Guffick claimed he asked pupils to make answers more legible, a panel found his conduct dishonest and banned him from the classroom for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard, a Manchester United goalkeeper, is married to Swedish model Misse Beqiri. They married last year in Mauritius and have a son, after dating since 2012. Despite struggling for game time at Manchester United since joining in 2010, Lindegaard is happy off the pitch with Beqiri, who is active on Instagram as a model with over 17,000 followers and has Albanian roots. Lindegaard is Danish.

Glowing blue letters from Yankee Stadium were put up for auction at Sotheby's but failed to sell. The letters were expected to sell for between $300,000 and $600,000, but the only bid of $260,000 came from a Sotheby's employee. Reggie Jackson, the current owner, purchased the letters after the stadium's final game in 2008. The letters were installed at Yankee Stadium in 1976 and removed in 2008.  Separately at the auction, a New York Mets bullpen car sold for $112,500, exceeding its estimated value.

Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities after Sterling was exposed for inhaling nitrous oxide and both were pictured with shisha pipes. Rodgers will not discipline them and wants to move on from the matter. Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa, which is Rodgers' priority as he aims to reach his first FA Cup final with Liverpool. Rodgers also discussed the importance of learning from losses in sport.

Mesut Ozil returned to London after playing for Germany in a Euro 2016 qualifier against Georgia, where they won 2-0. He is now focusing on playing for Arsenal against Liverpool in the Premier League. Ozil was relaxing at home with his dog after returning from international duty. He missed Arsenal's previous game against Newcastle due to illness but is expected to play in the upcoming game.  Ozil has been performing well since recovering from injury, scoring three goals and providing four assists since January. He believes he is adjusting to English football and enjoys the frequent games.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu has stated that they are 'very happy' with Luis Enrique and have no plans to replace him. Bartomeu refuted claims that Enrique would be replaced, stating he is impressed with his performance since he took charge last summer on a two-year deal. Bartomeu mentioned Enrique's contract runs until 2016 and that the club are happy as they could win three trophies. The passage also mentions Barcelona beat Valencia with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson, Liverpool's vice-captain, has agreed to a new long-term contract with the club. This contract is expected to be worth around Â£100,000 per week and will run until 2020. Henderson is the third Liverpool player, after Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho, to agree a contract extension. He was signed in June 2011 and has improved under Brendan Rodgers. Henderson may be considered for club captain when Steven Gerrard departs.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea until the end of his contract, despite Atletico Madrid considering bringing him back this summer. Luis signed a three-year contract last July but has struggled to secure a regular left back position. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho wants his team to remain focused to win every game and not rest until the league title is secured. Luis played for Brazil against France and Chile and now his attention is on the Premier League.

Nathan Hughes's three-match ban for an incident where his knee collided with George North's head, resulting in North being knocked out, was overturned on appeal.  Hughes received the initial ban and red card for being ârecklessâ during a match on March 27, even though there was no intent to harm North.  The incident, which was North's third knockout in two months, led to criticism of the ban, and Wasps appealed. The appeal panel concluded the incident was accidental and rescinded the ban, allowing Hughes to return to play immediately.

Fiery sunsets in Washington were caused by smoke from Siberian wildfires, which started due to farmers burning grass and intensified by winds on April 14. This smoke traveled across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, resulting in red sunsets because smoke particles filtered out other colors of sunlight. As the smoke dissipates, the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

A Missouri mom named Becky Schoenig from St. Louis had her brand new 2015 Ford Fusion stolen from her driveway one Monday night.  Police found her car on April 1st after a tip from a man who recognized it. When returned, the car had red rims, red detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel.  Schoenig reacted positively, thanking the thieves on Facebook for the changes.  Despite the positive reaction, the car had a strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana and needed professional cleaning. Schoenig is creating a smoothie at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, named 'The Sexton on Wheels' to honor the man who found her car.

Manchester City players, including Sergio Aguero, David Silva, Joe Hart, and Yaya Toure, will lose Â£500,000 in bonuses each if they do not qualify for the Champions League this season. These incentivised contracts are in place to comply with financial fairplay rules.  After losing to Manchester United, their Champions League qualification is uncertain.  The team is currently fourth in the Premier League, and the squad could lose a total of Â£12 million in bonuses if they fail to reach their European target. Manager Manuel Pellegrini has acknowledged the team's poor performance and struggles to attract top players like Paul Pogba, while Manchester United are now ahead and confident about future transfers.

Manchester United Under 18s won against Manchester City Under 18s 1-0 in a 'mini-derby' match. The match was played at Altrincham's Moss Lane and was attended by close to 1,000 people.  Callum Gribbin scored the only goal of the match for Manchester United with a free-kick. A significant number of players were English, with ten being Mancunian. The match was part of the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

England goalkeeper Joe Hart referred to Italian goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon as a 'legend of the game'. This was after Buffon claimed his 147th cap. Hart himself celebrated his 50th cap for England and stated Buffon was an inspiration to him. Hart mentioned he is still learning and admires Buffon's approach at 37 years old. Hart expressed pride in reaching 50 caps and wants to continue playing for his country.

Chipotle is entering the $70 billion food delivery market by partnering with Postmates to deliver to 67 cities.  A nine percent service charge will be added, with delivery fees starting at $5. Other franchises such as Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's and Burger King are also exploring the delivery market. Presidential candidates Marco Rubio and Hillary Clinton have been recently spotted at Chipotle.

The parents of the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombing are publicly requesting that the death penalty be removed as a sentencing option for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted on all charges related to the bombing.  They express that while acknowledging the severity of the crimes and the personal toll on their family, including the death of their son Martin and injuries to their daughter Jane, they believe pursuing the death penalty would prolong their anguish through years of appeals. They advocate for Tsarnaev to spend his life in prison without the possibility of release, in order to bring closure and allow their family and the city of Boston to move forward.

A jumbo jet, specifically a Boeing 747, has been transformed into a luxury home for an unknown billionaire. This custom-built plane, costing Â£400 million and taking three years to complete, features bedrooms, lounges, and a restaurant.  Originally designed for 600 passengers, this version is for a single tycoon and his guests, and includes a dining room, kitchen, lounge, state room, and an aeroloft with eight beds.  The interior is described as luxurious and hotel-like, with features such as a master bedroom, conference room, and guest relaxation areas.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying the Dragon spacecraft to the International Space Station from Cape Canaveral, Florida.  The attempt to land the rocket on a barge was unsuccessful as it landed too hard and tipped over. This was SpaceX's second attempt to land a rocket on a drone ship, with a previous attempt in January resulting in an explosion. SpaceX aims to master sea landings and then land on ground to reduce space travel costs by reusing rockets. The Dragon spacecraft is carrying supplies, including an espresso maker, to the ISS and will return to Earth with science experiments and trash after about five weeks, splashing down in the Pacific Ocean. This is SpaceX's sixth mission to the ISS, and the launch was delayed from Monday due to weather.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas, located in the Westgate Hotel. This chapel is part of the first permanent Graceland exhibit outside of Memphis.  Priscilla Presley is collaborating with NBC's Today show to host a contest for an Elvis-obsessed couple to win the 'ultimate wedding' at this chapel. The winning couple will also receive a free wedding reception, hotel suite, airfares, and tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show.  Couples must submit a video or photos to enter the contest. The winner will be announced next Monday and the wedding will be on Thursday, April 23. Priscilla Presley has stated that the chapel is serious and will not include impersonators.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool could catch Manchester City in the Premier League. Henderson and Simon Mignolet played their 47th game of the season in Liverpool's 2-0 win over Newcastle United. Liverpool are four points behind Manchester City. Raheem Sterling scored the first goal in the ninth minute and Joe Allen scored the second goal. Joe Allen admitted that Newcastle should have been awarded a penalty.

Roma defeated Napoli in a Serie A match, ending their four-month winless home streak.  The only goal was scored by Miralem Pjanic in the 25th minute following a counter-attack. Roma's goalkeeper, Morgan de Sanctis, made numerous saves to maintain the lead. This victory moved Roma ahead of Lazio in the league standings, while Napoli's winless streak extended to five games. Security was heightened for the match.

Doncaster Rovers are having an uninspired season in League One and are in mid-table mediocrity. Their match against Fleetwood Town was not expected to be exciting and ended in a 0-0 draw at the Keepmoat Stadium. The match was so uneventful that the media team created a very short 27-second highlight video for YouTube, including only 14 seconds of match action showing the kick off, a goal kick and the final whistle.

Cats and dogs can interact with humans through touch, unlike marine pets generally. However, one man, Roland Giroux, interacts with his blood parrot cichlid by stroking and massaging it in its tank. The fish appears to enjoy this interaction, returning to his hand and staying still to be massaged.  Mr. Giroux removed other fish from the tank because they were bullying his blood parrot cichlid. He started interacting with the fish by hand-feeding it and it became more sociable, now enjoying being stroked daily for at least 15 minutes. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid fish that was first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

Ben Stokes is known for his fiery character in the England cricket team. He previously broke his wrist punching a locker, reminding him to control his aggression.  Stokes clashed with Marlon Samuels but responded positively after speaking with coach Peter Moores.  Despite a slight back niggle, Stokes is back in the team after a year of ups and downs.  He is liked for his character and exuberance, which England wants to nurture but also manage carefully to ensure it translates to runs and wickets. England wants Stokes to reach his full potential and sees him and Chris Jordan as exciting prospects for the future.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier against Belgium at the Cardiff City Stadium on June 12 is a 33,000 sell-out. Both teams are top of Group B with 11 points, with Belgium ahead on goal difference. Wales' 3-0 victory over Israel has increased expectations for Wales to qualify for Euro 2016. Due to high demand after the Israel game, tickets for the Belgium match sold out. The Wales squad prefers to play at the Cardiff City Stadium, and UEFA rules prevented a change to the larger Millennium Stadium.

England's Under-17 squad has been announced by coach John Peacock for the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria next month.  As defending champions, England qualified with a 100 per cent record and are in Group D with Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. Their first game is against Italy in Burgas on May 7. The squad includes Jay Dasilva from Chelsea and other young players from Premier League clubs. Stephy Mavididi and Chris Willock are called up for the first time, while Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have been recalled.

Manchester City is interested in signing 14-year-old Anderlecht teenager Evangelos Patoulidis, who is considered a top talent.  Arsenal and Barcelona are also interested in the playmaker, who previously rejected Barcelona at age 12 to continue his studies. Manchester City has discussed a compensation package with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock as Manuel Pellegrini wants to build for the future by signing Patoulidis.

A 33-year-old Mexican national named Vanessa Santillan, who worked as a transgender escort, was found dead in a flat in Fulham, London at the end of March. She was found to have been strangled and beaten. A 23-year-old man has been arrested in connection with her death and bailed, pending further questioning. Police are appealing for information from anyone who had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death and are investigating the circumstances of her death.

A woman named Dawn who has had seven miscarriages appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show because Â£207 for her babies' gravestone was stolen. Dawn suspected her housemate Jamie, a convicted burglar, who was found to be lying by a lie detector test on the show, confirming he stole the money. Jamie confessed in a Facebook message but blamed his girlfriend Carol. Dawn was upset by the betrayal as she wanted to use the money for a gravestone for her baby Daniel James.

ISIS released over 200 Yazidis on Wednesday. The Yazidis are a minority group who were captured when ISIS took over their towns in northern Iraq last summer. Most of those released were women and children, with the remainder being ill or elderly. Arab tribal leaders helped coordinate the release, though the exact motivation is unclear. The released Yazidis were received by Peshmerga and sent to Irbil.  Previously, ISIS had released other Yazidis, mainly children and the elderly. ISIS' actions against Yazidis include killing, capturing, and displacing them, with severe cruelty including rape and enslavement. The Yazidis are a Kurdish group with a pre-Islamic religion and have faced long-term persecution.  An international coalition responded to the Yazidi crisis with airdrops, rescues, and airstrikes against ISIS.

Harry Kane of Tottenham has had an incredible season, breaking into both the first team and the England team. He is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season awards. An animation by Copa90 showcases his best goals and celebrations, including his 20th Premier League goal against Newcastle, goals against Chelsea and Arsenal, and his England debut goal. The animation, titled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?', is released before the awards ceremony where he is nominated for PFA Player of the Year alongside Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers should continue as Liverpool's manager despite a season without trophies and likely finishing outside the top four. Carragher thinks Rodgers needs to identify areas to improve within the team and make good signings for the next season. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside.

A four-year-old boy named James Hayward had his toy nerf gun confiscated by security at East Midlands Airport before his flight to Lanzarote. Airport security deemed the toy gun a security risk because it resembled a prohibited item, despite it being a brightly coloured plastic toy that fires sponge darts.  James's parents criticised the security staff as 'over-zealous' and 'ludicrous', but airport security defended their actions by stating they were following government regulations regarding items resembling prohibited items.  After returning from holiday, James was bought a replacement toy gun, and East Midlands Airport apologised for the inconvenience, offering to post the original toy home.

A man named Rich, aged 31 and living in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, has posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend or wife.  He lists requirements for his potential partner including being a non-drinker and non-smoker, fit, attractive, reliable, honest, loyal, good around the house, good with her hands, a good cook and great in bed, while also enjoying the outdoors and being a 'princess'.  He describes himself as athletic, white, heavily tattooed, 175cm tall, well endowed, non-drinking, non-smoking, non-drug user, owning property, making good money and successful, and offers benefits to the 'successful candidate' such as accommodation, possibly a company car, phone and laptop, gym membership and other benefits, stating he is 'not shy of blowin cash'. Former partners are told not to apply and the Daily Mail Australia was unable to contact him.

FA chairman Greg Dyke is proposing radical changes to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to twelve, facing opposition from the Premier League. The proposal includes changing the definition of 'home-grown' to mean trained in England for three years before the age of 18, instead of 21. Five former England managers, Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson, and Steve McClaren, have backed Dyke's proposals, warning that the English game will suffer if they are blocked. They believe the pool of English talent is shrinking and that young players need more opportunity despite the emergence of promising players.

Demelza Poldark has given birth to a baby daughter in the show. This occurs very quickly after the announcement of her pregnancy in the previous episode, with the show depicting her going from barely showing to giving birth in a very short time frame.  Ross Poldark is the father and is portrayed as a heartthrob.  Fans have noticed the unrealistic timeline of Demelza's pregnancy, similar to a previous pregnancy storyline with the character Elizabeth.

Leicester City, managed by Nigel Pearson, are in the Barclays Premier League and are attempting to avoid relegation.  After recent back-to-back wins, including a 3-2 victory against West Brom last week with a winning goal from Jamie Vardy, they are now three points from safety, although still at the bottom of the table.  Pearson has urged his team to focus on their own performance and not be distracted by their relegation rivals, emphasizing that their future is in their own hands and warning against excessive optimism.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara has achieved a record for the longest mammal migration, travelling nearly 14,000 miles. This journey, tracked by Oregon State University scientists, took her from Russia to Mexico, surpassing a previous record held by a humpback whale.  Varvara's visit to eastern gray whale breeding areas surprised scientists and suggests she may be an eastern gray whale, despite being initially thought to be western. This raises questions about the classification of endangered western gray whales.

A stretch of coastline on Shiretoko Peninsula near Rausu on Hokkaido Island, Japan, unexpectedly appeared overnight.  Measuring roughly 1,000 to 1,640ft long and 100ft wide, and rising 30 to 50ft above sea level, this new landmass was seabed that was forced to the surface. Geologists believe a landslide caused by melting ice and snow is the reason for this emergence. Local residents were surprised as they did not hear any sounds or feel tremors and authorities do not expect it to expand further, confirming it is not related to earthquakes.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied claims that he is leaving Paris Saint-Germain in the summer, stating he loves the club and wants to stay.  Despite a recent disagreement with his manager Laurent Blanc after being dropped for a game, Van der Wiel says he is happy at PSG and wants to sign a new contract.  Although he is happy at the club, Paris Saint-Germain is being linked with Barcelona player Dani Alves, which may impact Van der Wiel's future.

Carlos Tevez has been told he must terminate his contract with Juventus to return to Boca Juniors. Boca Juniors have confirmed they are close to completing a deal for the 31-year-old, but their president has stressed Tevez must terminate his contract with Juventus first, which runs until 2016. Juventus are reluctant to lose Tevez, who is their top scorer with 17 goals, but have accepted his wish to leave and are identifying replacements. Tevez previously played for Boca Juniors before joining Corinthians in 2005. Tevez's international manager claims any move would have no bearing on his Argentina future.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped his trousers during a Champions League match at the Allianz Arena against Porto. This occurred during Bayern Munich's 6-1 victory, in which they were leading 5-0 at half time. Guardiola joked about needing new trousers after his underwear was briefly visible. Bayern Munich progressed to the Champions League semi-finals, with goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and Robert Lewandowski (two goals).  Porto, who had a two-goal lead from the previous match, were defeated by Bayern Munich.

A multi-vehicle crash involving ten people, including four children, occurred on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale in Brisbane's west on Wednesday afternoon. Three vehicles were involved.  A 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy with chest pain were airlifted to Princess Alexandra Hospital.  Subsequently, a 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl with abdominal pain were also being airlifted. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for assessment. One man suffered hand lacerations and two females escaped injury. A person was trapped in a vehicle and freed by emergency crews using hydraulic cutting gear. The Brisbane Valley Highway was closed with diversions south of Fernvale.

Arsenal will play Chelsea in a Premier League match this weekend. Arsenal player Mesut Ozil received an Apple Watch and shared his excitement on Instagram, comparing it to a watch from Knight Rider. Ozil is expected to play in the match. Arsenal are currently second in the league, 10 points behind Chelsea. Jack Wilshere has returned from injury and was on the bench for a recent FA Cup match. Ray Parlour believes Wilshere is a quality player but his fitness is a concern.

Mark Clattenburg has been appointed referee for the Manchester derby. This is despite the fact he has sent off three players from both United and City this season.  City captain Vincent Kompany was sent off by Clattenburg in a Belgium match and is suspended for a game against Wales. Clattenburg has sent off two United players in the Premier League this season. The Manchester derby could decide who finishes second in the league behind Chelsea. United are currently above City and have won their last five league games, while City have struggled recently. Clattenburg will be assisted by Simon Beck and Jake Collin, with Jonathan Moss as the fourth official. Clattenburg has shown two red cards this season, both to United players, including Luke Shaw.

Bob Katter, a federal MP, accused the Queensland Government of believing Billy Gordon was 'a little black puppet on a string'. This accusation was made after Billy Gordon was accused of domestic violence and admitted to his criminal past, leading to his resignation from the Queensland Labor Party.  Despite resigning from the party, Billy Gordon announced he would remain in parliament as an independent, which caused chaos for the government.  Bob Katter questioned why it was assumed Billy Gordon would resign, contrasting it with past federal parliament cases.  Bob Katter defended his 'black puppet' comment by referencing his personal experiences and background, stating he believes the government deserves criticism for racial overtones.  The statement from Bob Katter has been criticised on social media.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Illinois with cerebral palsy, is using dance videos to inspire others and challenge negative perceptions of disability.  She aims to counteract stereotypes that people with cerebral palsy cannot do things and are different from others. Dayna has created multiple videos, including one set to Taylor Swift's 'Shake It Off', and she is also a motivational speaker at local schools.

Orlando City has expressed interest in Manchester United player Javier Hernandez, who is currently on loan at Real Madrid. Orlando City, coached by Adrian Heath, are interested because Hernandez would be a commercial draw and popular with their Latin-American fanbase.  Eight European sides are also interested in Hernandez, including Southampton, Stoke, West Ham, Everton, Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio and Inter Milan. Manchester United are willing to sell Hernandez for around Â£8 million.  Separately, Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old Andreas Pereira, after he rejected their first offer. Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven and Feyenoord are interested in Pereira.

Early on Saturday morning around 12:15am, at a 76 Station in South Los Angeles, a group of at least three people poured gasoline on a white Dodge Charger and set it on fire. This occurred after an argument between the driver and the suspects while the driver was pumping gas.  The suspects also attempted to carjack the driver before setting the car ablaze.  Two passengers were inside the car at the time of the fire.  No one was injured, but the car was completely ruined. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as arson and the suspects are still at large.

A chiropractor in Iowa, Charles Manuel, surrendered his state license after admitting to accepting sex as payment for services and performing exorcisms on patients. He admitted to misdeeds to the Iowa Board of Chiropractic and agreed not to apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years. Despite this, he received outstanding evaluations for patient satisfaction.

A U.S. reconnaissance plane was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet over the Baltic Sea in international airspace north of Poland. The U.S. is complaining to Moscow, stating the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional" due to aggressive maneuvers and high speed. Russia claims the U.S. plane was flying towards the Russian border with its transponder switched off, which a U.S. official denies. The U.S. will file a diplomatic petition with Russia. This is not the first such incident, as a similar event occurred a year ago. Encounters between Russian and U.S. aircraft are common.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from their car in a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot. The theft occurred at the Marriott Springhill Suites overnight on March 27, days before President Obama visited Utah. The rifle was secured in a hard case and locked to a truck safe, but the thief broke the car window, used a rope and possibly another vehicle to rip the rifle case out.  The agent's gear bag, backpack, clothing, and tools were also stolen. Police found evidence at the scene and some of the agent's belongings at a nearby hotel, but the rifle has not been recovered. The Secret Service was notified of the theft before the President's visit.

A 71-year-old man named Luigi Costa is accused of murdering his neighbour Terrence Freebody in July 2012 in Canberra. The alleged murder involved stomping, cutting the throat, and stabbing the victim.  At the time of the murder, Costa was believed to be suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse. A forensic psychiatrist believes Costa's mental state was declining and that Costa was in a confused state due to dementia and alcohol at the time of the killing, suggesting he may not have understood his actions.  However, the prosecutor suggested Costa may be feigning memory loss. Costa's state of mind is critical to the case as it could lead to a not guilty verdict if his unstable mindset at the time of the attack is proven.

Everton manager Roberto Martinez had to defend penalty decisions after Ross Barkley missed a penalty in a game against Burnley, despite Leighton Baines being a capable penalty taker. This event recalled a previous incident where Kevin Mirallas took a penalty from Baines and missed. Martinez stated Barkley was allowed to take the penalty and that Baines was happy for him to do so. Barkley's penalty was saved, but Everton won the game 1-0 with a goal from Mirallas.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the Holland America Line cruise ship ms Ryndam in Puerto Rico at 11:30 a.m. Thursday.  It appears to be a murder-suicide, according to the cruise line. Authorities, including the FBI, are investigating the incident which occurred on a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise that departed from Tampa, Florida on March 29. The deceased were discovered by cleaning staff.

Patrick Kluivert, former Holland forward and assistant coach, has started his role as coach of Curacao with a win in World Cup qualifying.  Curacao defeated Montserrat 4-3 on aggregate to advance to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament. Charlton Vicento, a former Holland Under 21 international, scored the decisive goal in the 87th minute of the second-leg match against Montserrat. Curacao will next face Cuba in the second round of qualifying. Kluivert was previously a World Cup semi-finalist as a player in 1998 and as an assistant coach in 2014.

Esteban Cambiasso, a player who has won major European competitions, believes that keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would be comparable to winning a trophy.  Leicester City is currently struggling in the Premier League and Cambiasso is determined to help them avoid relegation. Cambiasso previously played for Inter Milan and Real Madrid, winning numerous trophies including the Champions League and La Liga. He signed for Leicester City on a one-year deal and is happy at the club.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two children under five, is at risk of being banned from seeing her children by her 52-year-old mother, Debbie. Debbie has been caring for Gemma's children since they were four months old because Gemma prefers drinking and partying, and is suspected of stealing to fund this lifestyle. Debbie is considering the ban due to Gemma's continued drinking, partying, and suspected theft, as she believes Gemma is not fit to care for her children.

Chelsea forward Eden Hazard scored the first goal against Manchester United at Stamford Bridge on Saturday. Sky Sports pundits believed that Chelsea captain John Terry had fouled Manchester United striker Radamel Falcao in the build-up to the goal. Pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp and Graeme Souness agreed that Terry's challenge on Falcao was a foul during their half-time analysis.

Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway on Thursday morning. Everyone on board, including Hillary Scott, her husband, the tour manager, and the driver, evacuated safely. The fire started after a rear tire blew out and the bus stopped. The bus was destroyed by the fire, except for Hillary Scott's Bible. The other two members of Lady Antebellum were not on the bus.

Space lasers, often depicted in science fiction, are being explored for practical applications. Dr Adrian Quarterman, a Scottish scientist, is researching using space lasers to convert sun beams into energy via satellites. This energy could then be directed back to Earth to power homes and boost solar panels, potentially making solar power viable in places like Scotland and assisting disaster areas.  Separately, researchers in Tokyo have proposed using lasers on the International Space Station to target and remove small pieces of space debris by pushing them into Earth's atmosphere to burn up.  Both laser systems are stated to be unlike those in movies, not powerful enough to be weapons, though Dr Quarterman acknowledges potential concerns about control of the energy-producing satellites.

Donald Sterling's racist remarks previously resulted in him losing an NBA team.  Now, V. Stiviano, his former female companion, has been ordered by a Los Angeles judge to pay back over $2.6 million in gifts to Sterling's wife, Shelly Sterling, who sued her. Shelly Sterling accused Stiviano of exploiting wealthy older men and claimed Donald Sterling used their money to buy Stiviano luxury items like cars and a duplex.  Stiviano argued the gifts were consensual.  Shelly Sterling's lawyer stated this court decision is a victory and sets a precedent for recovering damages from recipients of ill-begotten gifts.  The gifts included not only expensive items but also smaller items like a blender and a costume. Donald Sterling's downfall began with an audio recording of him making racist remarks to Stiviano about her associating with African-Americans, including Magic Johnson.  This led to the NBA banning Sterling, fining him, and terminating his ownership of the franchise.

Thierry Henry has criticised Arsenal's recent transfer activity and suggested they need to buy four top players this summer.  Speaking after Arsenal's draw with Chelsea, Henry stated Arsenal require a goalkeeper, centre back, defensive midfielder, and striker to win the Barclays Premier League.  Henry also questioned if Arsenal can win the league with Olivier Giroud as their main striker, suggesting he may need replacing. He compared Arsenal's situation to Chelsea, who bought top players and are now likely to win the league.

Serge Gnabry, an Arsenal teenager midfielder, is feeling 'better and better' as he prepares to return after being out for more than a year due to a serious knee injury.  He last played for the first team in March 2014 in a Champions League game against Bayern Munich.  Gnabry played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading on Monday and is now over his injury. He impressed for Arsenal last season before his injury.

A 23-year-old graduate accountant named Jacob Phillips died after falling down a 70ft cliff in Penarth, South Wales. This occurred after he ran from a taxi to avoid paying the fare after a night out with friends in Cardiff in December.  Mr. Phillips and his friends did not have enough money for the taxi and planned to run without paying.  He ran in the dark, became disorientated, and fell off the cliff at the disused Northern Promenade. His body was found the next morning by a dog walker and a verdict of accidental death was recorded.

During last summer's passport delays, many holidaymakers did not receive compensation, despite the passport agency making a Â£42 million profit.  Managers at the agency received bonuses up to Â£3,500, while ministers refused blanket refunds for families affected by delays, even those who paid extra or missed trips.  Out of thousands affected, only 2,191 compensation applications were approved, with an average payout of Â£92.68. Ministers rejected full compensation to avoid setting a precedent. Keith Vaz, chairman of the Home Affairs Committee, expressed astonishment at the low compensation figures and the bonuses given to management.

A timewarp home from the 1930s, located in Horfield, Bristol, is for sale. This three-bedroom, semi-detached property retains original features such as stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, and retro food jars.  It includes an original bathroom and kitchen, a wood-panelled hallway, and vintage cupboards.  The house, described as a collector's paradise, has a guide price between Â£200,000 and Â£250,000 and will be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans and spent her early life there before moving to Texas and later San Francisco. Damon Albarn was raised in Leytonstone and Colchester and attended Stanway School where he formed Blur with Graham Coxon. Albarn's debut solo album 'Everyday Robots' was released on 28 April 2014, co-produced by Richard Russell, and featured collaborations and samples.
Mogadishu, also known locally as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. As the capital, many important national institutions of Somalia are based in Mogadishu.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by the American industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails. It is featured on their debut EP, Broken, which was released in 1992.

House, also known as House M.D., is an American television medical drama. It was broadcast on the Fox network for eight seasons, beginning on November 16, 2004 and ending on May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty in 1971 of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, including actress Sharon Tate. These deaths were carried out by members of his group at his instruction. Manson also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald `` Shorty '' Shea. After being charged with these crimes, recordings of songs written and performed by Manson were released commercially.

Sean Justin Penn, born on August 17, 1960, is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television in 1974 in Little House on the Prairie, directed by his father. His film debut was in Taps in 1981, and he gained critical attention for roles in crime dramas in the 1980s and 1990s. He became a leading actor with Dead Man Walking in 1995, receiving his first Academy Award nomination. He received further Oscar nominations for Sweet and Lowdown and I Am Sam, and won the Academy Award for Best Actor for Mystic River in 2003 and Milk in 2008.

Sir Donald George `` Don '' Bradman, also known as `` The Don '', was an Australian cricketer considered the greatest batsman of all time. After retiring, Bradman remained involved in cricket as an administrator, selector, and writer for three decades.
L.A. Reid has held chairman and CEO positions at Epic Records, Arista Records, and Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk is best known as the drummer for the rock bands Rage Against the Machine (1991-2000; 2007-11) and Audioslave (2001-07). He began his career as a drummer for Greta in 1990 and co-founded Rage Against the Machine in August 1991 with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha. As of 2016, he plays in Prophets of Rage with Commerford, Morello, Chuck D, B-Real and DJ Lord.

The multi-camera series 'The Millers' aired on CBS from October 3, 2013 to July 18, 2015. It ran for 34 episodes over two seasons before being cancelled on November 14, 2014, four episodes into its second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards, born September 1, 1933 and died September 13, 2006, was an American politician and the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat who gained national recognition as state treasurer of Texas and for her keynote address at the 1988 Democratic National Convention.  She was the second female governor of Texas and was known for her feminism and one-liners. She was defeated in her re-election bid in 1994 by George W. Bush. Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman, and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh, born Jeanette Helen Morrison on July 6, 1927 and died on October 3, 2004, was an American actress, singer, dancer and author. She wrote four books, including two novels.
The Bermuda Triangle, also called the Devil's Triangle, is a loosely-defined area in the western North Atlantic Ocean.  In this region, some ships and aircraft have reportedly vanished mysteriously.

Colin Kaepernick started his professional career as a backup to Alex Smith. He became the 49ers' starter in the 2012 season after Smith got a concussion. Kaepernick led the 49ers to the Super Bowl in 2012, where they lost to the Baltimore Ravens. In 2013, his first full season as starter, he helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship, but they lost to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a marketing communication using audio or visual forms. It is an openly sponsored and nonpersonal message used to promote or sell a product, service, or idea.  Advertising is different from personal selling because it is nonpersonal and is communicated through mass media such as newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor advertising, direct mail, search results, blogs, websites or text messages.
Private Lives is a comedy. It exists as a 1930 play in three acts by NoeÌl Coward, and as a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.

Maurice Harold Macmillan, also known as the 1st Earl of Stockton, was a British Conservative politician and statesman. He served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 10 January 1957 to 19 October 1963. He lived from 10 February 1894 to 29 December 1986.

Aristotle was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist born in Stagira, Chalkidice, during 384 -- 322 BC. He joined Plato's Academy in Athens at seventeen or eighteen and stayed until the age of thirty-seven. After Plato died, Aristotle tutored Alexander the Great at the request of Philip II of Macedon, beginning in 343 BC.

David Mordechai Packouz, born on February 16, 1982, is an American former arms dealer who is now a musician, inventor, and entrepreneur. He invented the BeatBuddy guitar pedal drum machine and is currently the CEO of the music technology company Singular Sound.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. He was drafted first overall by the Lakers in 1979 after winning championships in high school and college. In his rookie season, he won a championship and NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award. He won four more championships with the Lakers in the 1980s. He retired and returned in 1996 to play 32 games for the Lakers before retiring again. In 2009, Ebony magazine named him one of America's most influential black businessmen, and he has numerous business interests and was a part-owner of the Lakers.

Tenacious D is an American comedy rock duo formed in Los Angeles, California in 1994, consisting of Jack Black and Kyle Gass.  The band released three albums: Tenacious D (2001), The Pick of Destiny (2006), and Rize of the Fenix (2012). They gained popularity in 1997 through their television series and by supporting large rock acts.

James VI and I was King of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until he died on 27 March 1625.  Scotland and England remained individual states under his rule, though he advocated for a single parliament. He faced difficulties in England, such as the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and conflicts with the English Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the eighteenth series of the British reality television show Big Brother. Emma Willis is the host and Marcus Bentley is the narrator. Marcus Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster and voice-over artist, famous for narrating Big Brother UK since 2000 and is known for his voice and Geordie accent.

Saxony is a landlocked federal state of Germany, bordering other German states, Poland, and the Czech Republic. It is the tenth largest German state and the sixth most populous, with 4 million people. Saxony has a history spanning over a millennium and is a region for quality wine in Germany, being one of the northernmost wine regions in Europe located in former East Germany.
East End Park is a former major league baseball park in Cincinnati. "In the End" is a song by Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown started her solo career with the release of the song `` I Want You Back '' with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and the younger sister of both Miley and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra, also known as Pawn, is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai and starring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah in leading roles. Released on July 1, 1994, it became the second highest grossing Indian film of that year and received nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Raveena Tandon replaced Divya Bharti as the female lead after Bharti's death. The film is also known for its popular songs.

Shane Black, born on December 16, 1961, is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor. He is known for writing the action film 'Lethal Weapon' in 1987 and for his directorial debut with the film 'Kiss Kiss Bang Bang' in 2005.

Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, located in western New Guinea. It was formerly called Irian Jaya, and prior to that was known as West Irian or Irian Barat.  It once comprised all of Indonesian New Guinea.

Jennifer Lopez entered the music industry in 1999 with her album On the 6 and single `` If You Had My Love ''. In 2001, she was the first woman to have a number one album and film in the same week. Her relationship with Ben Affleck influenced her album This Is Me ... Then. She married Marc Anthony and starred in Shall We Dance?. After giving birth to twins in 2008, she returned to prominence in 2011 as an American Idol judge and with her successful single `` On the Floor ''.

Working animals are typically domesticated animals trained by humans to perform tasks. These tasks can include providing tractive force, milking, or herding. While wild animals can be trained to work, it is rare and often for entertainment, as they usually lack the temperament of domesticated working animals.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000. It was initially broadcast via closed-circuit television and later pay-per-view. Audioslave was a four-piece band formed by Chris Cornell of Soundgarden and members of Rage Against the Machine (Tom Morello, Tim Commerford, and Brad Wilk). Brad Wilk is known as the drummer for both Audioslave and Rage Against the Machine, and co-founded Rage Against the Machine in 1991. Rage Against the Machine was formed in 1991 and its members are Zack de la Rocha, Tim Commerford, Tom Morello, and Brad Wilk.

Janelle MonaÌe Robinson, born December 1, 1985, is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and model. She is signed to Wondaland Arts Society and Atlantic Records. In 2010, she released her first critically acclaimed album, The ArchAndroid, which was a concept album and a sequel to her first EP. It was released by Bad Boy Records.
Winter 's Tale is a novel by Mark Helprin that was published in 1983.

Lake Providence is a town and the parish seat of East Carroll Parish, located in northeastern Louisiana, United States.  The passage then discusses the University of Mississippi, stating that around 55 percent of undergraduates and 60 percent overall are from Mississippi, with 23 percent being minorities and international students coming from 90 nations.
Flaked was renewed for a second season consisting of six episodes in July 2016. The second season is scheduled to premiere on June 2, 2017.

Aaron Burr was elected to the New York State Assembly twice, from 1784 to 1785 and again from 1798 to 1799. He was New York State Attorney General from 1789 to 1791, and a U.S. Senator from New York from 1791 to 1797.  He reached the highest point of his career as vice president.

The Soyuz rocket was commissioned to launch Soyuz spacecraft as part of the Soviet human spaceflight program. It had initial test flights and manned launches. Designed in the 1960s by the Korolyov Design Bureau, it remains in service today. The Soyuz succeeded the Voskhod spacecraft and was originally built for the Soviet manned lunar programs.
Steve Ditko studied under Batman artist Jerry Robinson at the Cartoonist and Illustrators School in New York City.

Rage Against the Machine experienced tensions that caused Zack de la Rocha to leave, resulting in the band's breakup.  De la Rocha pursued a solo career. The remaining band members created Audioslave with Chris Cornell, releasing three albums before disbanding in 2007.  Rage Against the Machine reunited in 2007, performing at Coachella. Renegades, their fourth album, was released in 2000.

The S&P BSE SENSEX, also known as BSE 30 or SENSEX, is a stock market index of 30 companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Tata Motors is one of these companies and is also listed on the National Stock Exchange of India and the New York Stock Exchange.

Vietnam, officially known as the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, is located in Southeast Asia on the Indochina Peninsula. It is estimated to have 92.7 million inhabitants, making it the 14th most populous country in the world and the 9th most populous in Asia. Vietnam is bordered by China to the north, Laos to the northwest, and Cambodia to the southwest.  Across the Gulf of Thailand to the southwest is Thailand, and across the South China Sea to the east and southeast are the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia.  Vietnam has experienced high economic growth since 2000 and in 2011 had the highest Global Growth Generators Index among 11 major economies.  It is one of the world's four remaining one-party socialist states that officially espouses communism.
Dreamer is a 2005 American sports drama film. It was written and directed by John Gatins in his directorial debut.

Bhagat Singh was an Indian socialist revolutionary and folk hero of the Indian independence movement. He was known for two acts of dramatic violence against the British in India. He was executed at age 23 on 23 March 1931. Bhagat Singh became a popular folk hero after his death.

Aparshakti Khurana debuted in Bollywood with the movie `` Dangal ''. `` Dangal '' is a 2016 Indian Hindi-language biographical sports drama film directed by Nitesh Tiwari and is about a Wrestling competition.

James VI and I was king of Scotland from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland from 24 March 1603 until his death on 27 March 1625.  During his reign, Scotland and England were individual sovereign states, ruled by James in personal union, though he advocated for a single parliament.  As King of England, James faced difficulties with Parliament.

Danielle Cormack, born on 26 December 1970, is a stage and screen actress from New Zealand. She was an original cast member of Shortland Street and is known for roles in Xena: Warrior Princess as Ephiny, Cynthia Ross in The Cult, and Shota in Legend of the Seeker.  She has also appeared in the film Separation City, the Australian series Rake, and portrayed Kate Leigh in Underbelly: Razor.  Her notable recent role was Bea Smith in Wentworth, a role she played for four years, leaving in 2016.
Rob Sheridan, born on October 11, 1979, is an American graphic designer, director, and photographer. He is best known for his extensive work with the band Nine Inch Nails.

David Spade is an actor who has starred and co-starred in films such as Tommy Boy, Black Sheep, Joe Dirt, Joe Dirt 2 : Beautiful Loser , Grown Ups , and Grown Ups 2 . Joe Dirt 2 : Beautiful Loser is a 2015 American comedy film directed by Fred Wolf and written by David Spade and Fred Wolf .
Angela Evelyn Bassett, born on August 16, 1958, is an American actress.

Artpop is an album that received generally mixed reviews from music critics, but was commercially successful. It debuted at number one on the United States Billboard 200 with 258,000 first-week sales, becoming Gaga 's second consecutive number-one record in the United States. It sold 757,000 copies and was the ninth best selling album of 2013 with 2.3 million copies worldwide.

John Frusciante released his fifth and final album with the Chili Peppers, called Stadium Arcadium, in 2006. This album was the last one featuring guitarist John Frusciante, who left the band in 2009.

Margaret Thatcher was a Prime Minister who implemented policies known as Thatcherism. She is a controversial figure, considered both one of the greatest and most influential politicians in British history, and the subject of ongoing arguments regarding Thatcherism.

Duff McKagan, born on February 5, 1964, is an American musician, singer, songwriter, and author.  He is also a writer, known for his weekly columns on diverse subjects for SeattleWeekly.com, Playboy.com, and ESPN.com.
Tom Baker is an English actor who has narrated commercials, video games, audiobooks and television series in addition to acting.

Valencia, officially ValeÌncia, is the capital of the autonomous community of Valencia and Spain's third largest city after Madrid and Barcelona. It has around 800,000 inhabitants in the administrative centre and is Spain's third largest metropolitan area, with a population of 1.7 to 2.5 million. The Valencian Community is an autonomous community of Spain, and Valencia is its capital.
Buffy Summers was portrayed by Kristy Swanson in a film and Sarah Michelle Gellar in a television series.
Make It or Break It ended after the third season. This was announced on April 26, 2012, and the final episode aired on May 14, 2012.

Speech recognition is a sub-field of computational linguistics focused on enabling computers to recognize and translate spoken language into text. It combines knowledge from linguistics, computer science, and electrical engineering. Speech recognition has various applications including voice user interfaces like voice dialing and call routing, appliance control, search, data entry, document preparation, speech-to-text processing, and in aircraft.  Advances in speech recognition are shown by increased academic publications and industry adoption of deep learning methods by companies such as Google, Microsoft, IBM, Baidu, Apple and Amazon.

Richard Alf (January 26, 1952 â January 4, 2012) was an American businessman and former comic book store owner. He co-founded the San Diego Comic-Con International in 1970, originally named the Golden State Comic Book Convention. He served as its chairman beginning in 1970. The San Diego Comic-Con was founded by Richard Alf, Shel Dorf, Ken Krueger and Mike Towry. It was later called the "San Diego Comic Book Convention".
Fist of Legend is a remake of the 1972 movie Fist of Fury, which had Bruce Lee as the main actor.

Dubuisson of France and Van Zyl of South Africa are tied for the lead at 16 under par. McIlroy is in third place at 15 under par along with Kiradech Aphibarnrat of Thailand. McIlroy's round included an eagle and he is aiming for his first title since May. McIlroy is also targeting a third Race to Dubai title. Chris Wood and Richard Bland are in fifth and seventh place respectively.

Sheikh Ali Salman stated that for national dialogue to be meaningful, the government must offer "concrete solutions" and have a representative from the royal family present.  He mentioned that Crown Prince Salman al-Khalifa is seen as a reformist, contrasting with hardliners like Prime Minister Sheikh Khalifa bin Salman al-Khalifa who oppose dialogue.  Sheikh Salman welcomed dialogue but acknowledged that many young protesters distrust opposition parties. He highlighted a previous agreement with the Crown Prince for a seven-point plan towards a constitutional monarchy, which was disrupted by the intervention of GCC troops in 2011.  Sheikh Salman expressed hope that new US Secretary of State John Kerry would pressure Bahrain more on human rights and democratic practices, and criticized the UK's private approach to urging reform, advocating for public pressure instead.  He reiterated al-Wefaq's commitment to peaceful demonstrations and called for the release of 13 opposition leaders, stating their inclusion is crucial for the dialogue's success.

This person died at their home in Cambridge after an illness.  A private funeral will be held, with a memorial service at a later date.  They were a conductor and influential in early music, founding the Academy of Ancient Music (AAM) in 1973 and directing it for around 30 years. The AAM made over 200 CDs, including a complete cycle of Mozart symphonies on period instruments and a famous 1980 recording of Handel's Messiah. They held positions at the Academy of Saint Martin-in-the-Fields, Early Music Consort of London, King's Lynn Festival, Boston's Handel and Haydn Society, Harvard University, University of Cambridge and Cornell University.

In the year ending in March, there were 57 homicide victims recorded, which is a decrease of five from the previous 12 months and the lowest number since 1976.  As of March 31st 2016, only one homicide case from 2015-16 remained unresolved. Sharp instruments, mostly knives, were the most common method of killing, accounting for 51% of homicides.  31% of accused individuals were identified as being under the influence of alcohol or alcohol and drugs. Justice Secretary Michael Matheson acknowledged the continued fall in homicides but stressed the need for continued efforts in education and enforcement. Claire Baker noted caution regarding the statistics, referencing previous upward revisions and highlighting increases in sexual and violent crime in Scotland. The number of homicide victims for 2014-15 was initially reported as 59 but was later revised to 62.

Bournemouth lost to Sunderland 2-1 in a Premier League match on Saturday. Bournemouth scored first with a Dan Gosling goal, their first goal in three games. Sunderland scored goals from Victor Anichebe and a Jermain Defoe penalty to win. Bournemouth were unable to equalise, even when Sunderland had a player sent off. Bournemouth manager Howe stated they had enough chances to win but did not score.

Australian Prime Minister Mr Abbott stated that preventing deaths at sea requires stopping boats. Australia detains migrants arriving by boat and sends them to offshore processing camps. The New York Times described this policy as "brutal", "inhumane", of "dubious legality", and against Australia's tradition, warning against its adoption by European leaders.  Mr Abbott connected stopping boats to preventing deaths like that of Alan Kurdi.  Mr Abbott also said IS was worse than the Nazis, which angered Australian Jewish groups who found the comparison "injudicious and unfortunate". Mr Abbott later stood by his comments but said he was not "ranking evil".

Washington blamed Russia and the Syrian government for intensifying attacks against civilians, leading the US to warn it would halt talks unless Russia stopped bombing Aleppo.  The US then suspended talks with Russia, stating Russia failed to uphold commitments and targeted infrastructure and prevented aid, including an attack on an aid convoy. Russia regretted the US decision, accusing the US of shifting blame for the truce collapse and failing to improve humanitarian conditions around Aleppo and divide jihadists from opposition groups.  The US and Russia were due to meet to coordinate airstrikes, but this was cancelled, although they will continue to discuss counter-terrorism operations.

A report by Policy Exchange suggests selling vacant high-value social homes could raise Â£4.5bn annually, potentially funding 80,000 to 170,000 new social homes.  Policy Exchange argues this would be the largest social house building programme since the 1970s and boost the economy.  They claim social housing would remain in expensive areas, but less of it, and that it is fairer to house more families than to have one family in a very expensive home.  The government indicated councils could consider this to efficiently use housing stock and reduce waiting lists.  However, Labour and others criticize the proposal, arguing it would displace low-wage families, break up communities, and create segregation.  They suggest alternative solutions like using a bank bonus tax to fund affordable homes. Critics also point out cuts to previous social housing programmes and express concern about pushing less affluent people out of expensive areas.

A 25-year-old man named Gareth Colfer-Williams died at his home in Swansea, a city experiencing a measles epidemic of 942 cases.  It is not yet known if measles caused his death, and further tests are needed. An inquest will be opened.  Mr Colfer-Williams had recently been treated for asthma and developed a rash before his death. He saw a GP about the rash the day before he was found dead.  Measles was diagnosed, but the cause of death is still to be determined. His family is unsure how he contracted measles.

Vincent Hudson has been charged by Cumbria Police with a historical offence on a boy under the age of 16. The alleged attack was reported to have taken place in 2001. Mr Hudson, aged 54 and from Whitehaven, is due to appear before North Cumbria Magistrates' Court.

Gateshead and Guiseley played a National League match. Guiseley scored first in the 15th minute with a goal by Jake Lawlor, assisted by James Hurst. Gateshead equalized in the 62nd minute with a goal from Wes York. The final score was Gateshead 1, Guiseley 1. There were substitutions and yellow cards issued during the match.

Bristol Sport Ltd plans to replace two stands at the football club to increase capacity. This is instead of building a new stadium at Ashton Vale, which has been delayed. Majority shareholder Steve Lansdown confirmed at a shareholder meeting on Tuesday that work would begin. The work was approved by Bristol City Council in November. If there is no judicial review by March, redevelopment plans will go ahead, starting in May.
